summary: This document consists of six 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019. The sheets are for Tiers G, H, J, K, L, and M, documenting the required irregular observation rounds for inmates in continuous lockdown status. The sheets are reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.

persons.name: Morning Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer responsible for reviewing the 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The senior officer who, along with the Morning Watch Lieutenant, reviews the completed 30-minute check sheets.

events.title: SHU Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Standard 30-minute observation rounds conducted for inmates held in the Special Housing Unit (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at MCC New York.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a routine prison log showing 30-minute observation checks for inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York on August 10, 2019.
The check sheets cover six different tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) within the Special Housing Unit.
The procedure requires staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule, with observations no more than 40 minutes apart.
Each sheet is marked as 'CONFIDENTIAL' and was reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The document itself does not name any specific inmates, including Jeffrey Epstein, but establishes the monitoring protocol for the unit where he was held.
